newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico expresses concern over Gulf conflict.
newsitem.headline: Mexico expresses concern over Gulf conflict.

text.p: Mexico on Wednesday expressed concern over the conflict between the United States and Iraq and urged both sides to avoid any act that raised tensions in the region.

"The Foreign Ministry expresses its concern at the events that have occured in the Persian Gulf and it calls on all states to avoid all forceful actions that escalate tensions and confrontation," a statement said.

The United States has launched two waves of cruise missile attacks on southern Iraq and enforced an extended no-fly zone in response to Baghdad's dispatch of troops into areas of Kurdish-held northern Iraq.

The Mexican Foreign Ministry said it was only the United Nations Security Council that was authorised to use force to confront agressive acts, and added it was confident the council would act responsibly on the U.S.-Iraq issue.
